snippet: The missionary, Piero Parolari, who was wounded, is an Italian physician who has lived in the northern region of the country for more than 30 years.
abstract: Authorities in Dinajpur district, Bangladesh, investigate shooting of Piero Parolari, physician and Roman Catholic missionary; attack on doctor, who is recovering from bullet wound to head, follows two previous assaults on foreigners; Bangladeshi officials have dismissed claims that Islamic State is responsible for attacks, instead identifying suspects associated with Jamaat-e-Islami, an Islamist party aligned with political opposition.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The missionary, Piero Parolari, who was wounded, is an Italian physician who has lived in the northern region of the country for more than 30 years.

headline.main: Assailants in Bangladesh Attack Catholic Missionary
headline.print_headline: A Catholic Missionary Is Attacked in Bangladesh
